hints.content:
We know the $\greenD{\text{total}}$:

There are $\greenD{56}$ hotel rooms.


And we know the $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$:

There are $\blueD7$ floors.

The quotient will tell us the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$.

In this problem, the $\purpleC{\text{size of the groups}}$ is the $\purpleC{\text{number of rooms on each floor}}$.
The quotient tells us the $\purpleC{\text{number of rooms on each floor}}$.

question.content:
There are $56$ rooms in a hotel split evenly between $7$ floors.

**What does the expression $56\div7$ represent?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 2]]

choices.content: Number of rooms on each floor
